message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM

This paper deals with biomedical image segmentation using a novel approach to encode topological knowledge on the inter-class relationships, specifically containment/nesting. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The proposed approach involves introducing a multi-level activation layer, which is a generalization of logistic regression, and proposing three compatible losses. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The use of CNN architectures and benchmarking on a segmentation task also supports these sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a method that can be integrated into any CNN architecture, indicating that it may also belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with biomedical images, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
